pr_title: [Cross Client Batching LeaderTimes - 3b] | AtlasDb accepts external request batcher for LeaderTime api

timeline.bodyText: wow, it really needs this type hint to work? Funky
timeline.author: Jolyon-S
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1200,6 +1223,24 @@ private static LockAndTimestampServices getLockAndTimestampServices(
                 .build();
     }
 
+    private static LeaderTimeGetter getLeaderTimeGetter(
+            String timelockNamespace,
+            Optional<TimeLockRequestBatcherProviders> timelockRequestBatcherProviders,
+            AtlasDbDialogueServiceProvider serviceProvider,
+            LeaderElectionReportingTimelockService namespacedConjureTimelockService) {
+        return timelockRequestBatcherProviders
+                .map(TimeLockRequestBatcherProviders::leaderTimeBatcherProvider)
+                .map(provider -> provider.getBatcher(getMultiClientTimelockServiceSupplier(serviceProvider)))
+                .<LeaderTimeGetter>map(batcher -> new NamespacedCoalescingLeaderTimeGetter(timelockNamespace, batcher))

timeline.author: Jolyon-S
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,24 @@

+ * limitations under the License.

+
+package com.palantir.atlasdb.config;
+
+import com.palantir.lock.client.InternalMultiClientConjureTimelockService;
+import java.util.function.Supplier;
+
+public interface BatcherProvider<T> {
+    T getBatcher(Supplier<InternalMultiClientConjureTimelockService> multiClientConjureTimelockService);

timeline.bodyText: This broadly makes sense. As a matter of style I'd probably write this imperatively as there is a fair bit to take in, but this is fine if you prefer.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1200,6 +1223,24 @@ private static LockAndTimestampServices getLockAndTimestampServices(
                 .build();
     }
 
+    private static LeaderTimeGetter getLeaderTimeGetter(
+            String timelockNamespace,
+            Optional<TimeLockRequestBatcherProviders> timelockRequestBatcherProviders,
+            AtlasDbDialogueServiceProvider serviceProvider,
+            LeaderElectionReportingTimelockService namespacedConjureTimelockService) {
+        return timelockRequestBatcherProviders
+                .map(TimeLockRequestBatcherProviders::leaderTimeBatcherProvider)
+                .map(provider -> provider.getBatcher(getMultiClientTimelockServiceSupplier(serviceProvider)))
+                .<LeaderTimeGetter>map(batcher -> new NamespacedCoalescingLeaderTimeGetter(timelockNamespace, batcher))

timeline.bodyText: can we name this timelockRequestBatcherProviders for consistency?
timeline.author: jeremyk-91
jeremyk-91
